pullRequest.body:
Define transcendence degree `Algebra.trdeg` and proves some basic properties:

+ In **AlgebraicIndependent/Basic.lean**: define `Algebra.trdeg` to be the supremum of the cardinalities of all AlgebraicIndependent sets, just like `Module.rank` is defined to be the supremum of the cardinalities of all LinearIndependent sets. Add some API lemmas and trivial results about `trdeg`.

+ In **AlgebraicIndependent/TranscendenceBasis.lean**, we show:

+ + The AlgebraicIndependent sets in a domain form a Matroid, and use it to show all transcendence bases have the same cardinality.

+ + Transcendence bases are exactly algebraic independent families that are "almost generating" (i.e. the whole algebra is algebraic over the algebra generated by the family). On the other hand, an "almost generating" set in a domain contains a transcendence basis.

+ + There always exists an transcendence basis between an arbitrary AlgebraicIndependent set and an "almost generating" set in a domain.

+ + `trdeg R S + trdeg S A = trdeg R A` in a domain, which depends on `AlgebraicIndependent/IsTranscendenceBasis.sumElim_comp`.

+ + A finite AlgebraicIndependent family (or an "almost generating" family) in a domain that has the same cardinality as `trdeg` must be a transcendence basis.

+ In **AlgebraicIndependent/Transcendental.lean**: add API lemmas and show the inequality `trdeg R S + trdeg S A â‰¤ trdeg R A` (which does not require a domain).

+ In **AlgebraicIndependent/Defs.lean**: add Stacks tags and some trivial API lemmas about IsTranscendenceBasis.

Thanks to @ChrisHughes24 and @acmepjz for preliminary works and @apnelson1 for the hint about Finitary and IndepMatroid.

TODO:

+ Inequalities between `trdeg`s induced by injective/surjective AlgHom, and equality induced by AlgEquiv.

+ [The analogue of StrongRankCondition](https://mathoverflow.net/a/484564) in the setting of algebras, which implies `trdeg R (MvPolynomial (Fin n) R) = n` for all Nontrivial CommRing R.

---

- [ ] depends on: #20888

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#20888
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> TODO:
> 
> * Inequalities between `trdeg`s induced by injective/surjective AlgHom, and equality induced by AlgEquiv.

I think injective AlgHom version should be a consequence of your `lift_trdeg_add_le` (if not `Injective (algebraMap R S)` then it's `0 = 0`), and `AlgEquiv` version is a corollary of it (by the inequality of injectivity of the map and its inverse, or maybe we should add `AlgEquiv` preserves `AlgebraicIndependent` (which I think we already have it, EDIT: [AlgHom.algebraicIndependent_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/AlgebraicIndependent/Basic.html#AlgHom.algebraicIndependent_iff) and [algebraicIndependent_ringHom_iff_of_comp_eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/AlgebraicIndependent/Basic.html#algebraicIndependent_ringHom_iff_of_comp_eq)) and `IsTranscendenceBasis`). I'm not sure of surjective AlgHom version, though.

```
def matroid : Matroid A := (indepMatroid inj).matroid.copyBase 
univ 
 (fun s â†¦ IsTranscendenceBasis R ((â†‘) : s â†’ A)) 
 (fun B â†¦ by rw [Matroid.base_iff_maximal_indep, isTranscendenceBasis_iff_maximal]; rfl)
```

for defeq with `M.Base`. 

(I haven't tested this)
This looks like `Algebra.IsAlgebraic (adjoin R t) A` might be equivalent to `(AlgebraicIndependent.matroid _).Spanning t`. If so, the API for `Spanning` could be helpful going forward.

Indeed, that's very satisfying! Also I think `Flat` means being an algebraically closed subalgebra, and `closure` is equal to `Subalgebra.algebraicClosure` of `Algebra.adjoin`. Might be able to golf this proof with it?

Possibly the way to organize things if you want to go this way is to have a file `Data.Matroid.Algebraic` that has the definition of an algebraic matroid, as well as a bunch of lemmas like `spanning_iff`, `base_iff`, `flat_iff`, etc that relate the transcendence basis concepts to the matroid concepts. 

Then proofs for facts about transcendence that are really matroidal will follow from rewrites and `Matroid` lemmas. For example, the above lemma is just `Indep.exists_base_subset_spanning` from #20885
`trdeg` is a kind of `rank`, right? I think all these probably have generalizations to matroids. (Of course the matroid results need not worry about `Cardinal.lift`.)
Yes, if it's 'maximum cardinality of an independent subset', then it's matroidal rank. A lot of API for this should belong in `Matroid.Rank.Cardinality` once it's up and running.
Is Cardinality a different file than Cardinal.lean that is added in #20888?
Maybe mark this as `@[nontriviality]`? Perhaps same as the above `isTranscendenceBasis_iff_of_subsingleton`.

The name of this theorem is a little bit confusing, probably because the previous `AlgebraicIndependent.option_iff` is also. Both of them mentions `Option.elim`, and seems that the existing `AlgebraicIndependent.option_iff` is just a special case of `AlgebraicIndependent.optionElim_iff`. Do you think we should called the existing one `option_iff_transcendental`, and the newly added one `option_iff`?

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra): Transcendence degree
